definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag

sentences.english: This step also also ensures that the database icon is used as the bookmark icon.
sentences.chinese: 這個步驟還可以確保使用數據庫圖標作爲書籤圖標。

sentences.english: Bookmarks have changed on disk and are being reloaded.
sentences.chinese: 已經在磁盤上更改了書籤，正在被重新裝入。

sentences.english: What happens to my existing bookmarks when I install Foxmarks? Will my bookmarks get overwritten?
sentences.chinese: 安裝了這套件後我的書籤會不會被蓋掉？

sentences.english: Because of that, it can be bookmarked for future recall.
sentences.chinese: 因此，可將其加入書籤以便將來重新調用。

sentences.english: There’s even a blue nylon bookmark glued into the spine.
sentences.chinese: 書脊處甚至粘着尼龍書籤繩。

sentences.english: Can enterprises benefit from social bookmarking and wikis?
sentences.chinese: 公司能從社會化書籤與維基中獲益嗎？

sentences.english: While the link-sharing part of the service doesn't require a login, the bookmarking function does require users to register accounts.
sentences.chinese: 網址分享服務無需登陸，而書籤功能則需要註冊。
動態頁面不能用書籤標記。

sentences.english: Navigate through the bookmarks by double-clicking them.
sentences.chinese: 通過雙擊書籤來進行導航。

sentences.english: Fully embossed cover, 3 ribbon place markers and double expandable inner pocket.
sentences.chinese: 全封面壓印，3條絲帶書籤，兩層後頁小袋。

sentences.english: You can also add bookmarks and feeds to the group.
sentences.chinese: 還可以向這個羣組添加書籤和提要。

sentences.english: You can arrange the site with the predefined bookmark settings.
sentences.chinese: 您可以利用預先定義好的書籤設置來規劃站點。

sentences.english: Rick Reo says social bookmarking is especially useful when creating a collection of resources to be shared with others.
sentences.chinese: 瑞克說社會書籤對創建可供分享的資源尤其有用。

sentences.english: Using Ajax think about search engines and user bookmarks.
sentences.chinese: 使用Ajax時要考慮搜索引擎和用戶書籤。

sentences.english: It can also create bookmarks and links to them.
sentences.chinese: 它還可以創建書籤，以及對書籤的鏈接。

definition: to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
to glue to/to paste onto/to stick on/also written 粘貼|粘贴[zhan1 tie1]
